class Config[source]

Config(other_config=None)

Manage config stuff.

Attributes
-------
path: pathlib.Path

The key, value pairs found in the config file become attributes of the
class instance after initialization.
At minimum, there should be the `archive_path` attribute for storing data
for this package.
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

The Config() object

The config module instantiates a config object from the Config class. Its attributes can be used to access several aspects relevant to the configuration of planetarypy. Using an object approach enables easy growth and nesting over time. {% include note.html content='Any cell that starts with an # export becomes part of the library. Any other cells become automatically part of tests' %}

{% raw %} 
config = Config()
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

Config.get_config[source]

Config.get_config()

Read the configfile and store config dict.

If found, load config via `toml` and set each found (key, value) pair as
(attribute, value) pair in the `config` object.

At a minimum, `planetarypy` needs a `data_archive` path.
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
config.data_archive

'/home/maye/big_drive/planetary_data/planetarypy'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
config.data_archive_path

Path('/home/maye/big_drive/planetary_data/planetarypy')
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
config.d

{'data_archive': '/home/maye/big_drive/planetary_data/planetarypy'}
{% endraw %}
